result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Kegel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with the minors listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
Follow through with any treatment or counselinge recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours, release for standard conditions. FIRST 30 days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. LAST 60 days are STAYED for compliance with Day Report Center. No Good Time on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes DRC the 60 days of Stayed Huber will be permanently stayed.

dated 04-02-2021 from Samuel Kegel requesting expungement;  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 04-13-2020, this document is deemed filed 04-03-2021 because that is the date it was mailed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel J Kegel in court with Attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Sengstock makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant's father makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign relases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: minors listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions -LAST 60 DAYS STAYED for 60 DAYS DAY REPORT CENTER.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 60 Days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed.  First 30 Days is STAYED for use of agent.  

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant  

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-16-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Samuel J Kegel in court with Attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sengstock requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 10-26-2015 09:00 am
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Samuel J Kegel in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness except employees of the Eisenhower School listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Samuel J Kegel in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
